intro: Nigella arvensis var. glauca, commonly known as the blue hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and erect. The seeds, which are small and black, are often dispersed by wind and can remain viable in the soil for several years.
